urls.title: Dani Garavelli: The past really is another country
urls.description: I blame the famous Limmy sketch. The one where the man walks into a ticket office, shows the woman behind the counter a photograph of Millport and asks her how to get there. The problem is it’s not so much Millport he wants to revisit, but his youth. Long summer days spent drinking Merrydown cider and jumping off the pier. The friends, the freedom, no thought for the future. A time all the more precious for the knowledge it can never be reclaimed.

urls.description: Social historian, Daniel Gray on his latest book, The Silence of the Stands, a love letter to lockdown football, collecting Panini stickers and looking forward to Gareth Southgate looking unflappable in a suit in Qatar.

urls.title: Christmas Gift - Nutmeg Magazine
urls.description: The perfect gift for the football-obsessed The next four issues of the football publication that’s a high-class home for quality articles about Scottish football past, present and future. Published every three months, it offers opinion, reflection, interviews, insight, photography and poetry… a unique blend between uniquely elegant pages. It’s our game, in print. Our Christmas Gift offer of £45 includes: A FREE copy of Nutmeg Issue 26* (December 2022) to give along with a Nutmeg gift card, which you can personalise. It’s a wee taster and something to wrap. Throughout 2023, each of 4 quarterly issues (27-30) will be delivered to the address of your gift recipient. Order by Monday 19 December to guarantee delivery for Christmas *Issue 22 will be sent to the gift receiver unless you say otherwise. If you would like it to be sent directly to you simply leave a message in the 'order notes' field. *Postage & Packing is £2 per issue for UK orders (Europe - £8 per issue /RoW - £10 per issue)

urls.title: Podcast | When Saturday Comes
urls.description: Twice a month the team consider a range of compelling issues including comedic terrace abuse, little and large strike partnerships, and Don Revie’s fear of ornamental elephants. The line-up: Andy Lyons WSC editor • Harry Pearson WSC columnist • Daniel Gray author & presenter • Plus special guests Subscribe for free:  Apple  /  Spotify  /  Google Podcast  /  Stitcher  /  TuneIn+Alexa Join the WSC Supporters’ Club to get bonus episodes, exclusive merchandise and more!

urls.title: Player Take Over: Highs, Lows & Turmeric - Nutmeg Magazine
urls.description: Michael Devlin updates Daniel Gray on his move to Fleetwood and hitting a maximum high before a crushing low in the space of a few days.

urls.title: ‎Nutmeg Magazine: E74 - Player Take Over: Highs, Lows & Turmeric on Apple Podcasts
urls.description: ‎Show Nutmeg Magazine, Ep E74 - Player Take Over: Highs, Lows & Turmeric - 25 Nov 2022

urls.title: E74 - Player Take Over: Highs, Lows & Turmeric
urls.description: Listen to this episode from Nutmeg Magazine on Spotify. Michael Devlin updates Daniel Gray on his move to Fleetwood and hitting a maximum high before a crushing low in the space of a few days. Then, Michael’s former Aberdeen team-mate Tommie Hoban joins him again - Michael felt there was still more to discuss about Tommie’s decision to suddenly quit the game aged 27, and other revealing topics about the sheer fragility of being a footballer. Never read Nutmeg magazine? We have offers on back issues and subscriptions. See https://www.nutmegmagazine.co.uk/shopSupport the show

urls.title: Dani Garavelli: The past really is another country
urls.description: I blame the famous Limmy sketch. The one where the man walks into a ticket office, shows the woman behind the counter a photograph of Millport and asks her how to get there. The problem is it’s not so much Millport he wants to revisit, but his youth. Long summer days spent drinking Merrydown cider and jumping off the pier. The friends, the freedom, no thought for the future. A time all the more precious for the knowledge it can never be reclaimed.

@d_gray_writer @WaterstonesYork May well pop down and grab a copy over the weekend 👍🏻😁
@d_gray_writer @WaterstonesYork Although this is probably in the literature section. https://t.co/mXxlizo2k7
@d_gray_writer @WaterstonesYork Shame it's not surrounded by hooligan books.

annotations.normalized_text: The Silence of the Stands: Finding the Joy in Football’s Lost Season

tweets.text:
The Silence of the Stands: Finding the Joy in Football’s Lost Season

@DuncMcKay talks to author @d_gray_writer in our next episode of Book Club!

Listen on our £2-per-month (is that all?!) Patreon tier:

https://t.co/TZIHkD20eL https://t.co/j07BKjd2tH

“It felt like Saturday afternoon inside a cosy period drama about a veterinary practice. This was a blissful little town”

And what a blissful little book this is! A powerful paean to the restorative nature of sport. Thanks for the nostalgia trip @d_gray_writer ⚽️ https://t.co/YV46BxtccN
Thank you Daniel @d_gray_writer and it's time to put your feet up and watch the footie.

Our day ended with a lovely family event with @d_gray_writer . Readings, good chat and sharing both life's delights and stories. Scoring at improving literacy is a lot of fun!
Bonus; hearing about a player with @ElginCityFC who left Elgin to go to Russia to meet Lenin #greatstory https://t.co/Ld0v0KwaLo
@d_gray_writer Lovely looking little ground 👍

tweets.text:
“The Silence Of The Stands encapsulates a world of football that is rarely covered in the mainstream media but which is really the beating heart of the game in these islands..."

My review on Substack of the latest book by @d_gray_writer 

https://t.co/ciKlqhvaEv

@d_gray_writer @BloomsburySport @DLuxAssociates @YfrontFanzine @Yorktone The real tragedy was not knowing what would be our last game at Bootham.

We had no chance to say a proper goodbye.

@d_gray_writer @BumbleCricket @BloomsburySport @DLuxAssociates @YfrontFanzine @Yorktone Great video and narration. My first ever live football match was there in 1969 against Workington, a 1-0 defeat as Gordon Morritt was beaten from the spot.
In the ensuing years I spent many a Friday night in the popular stand watching Phil Boyer and Albert Johanssen. Great times.
Off on another research/interviewing trip. @d_gray_writer my trusty travelling companion https://t.co/yQylxXXiQr
This is wonderful. Proper football ground was Bootham Crescent https://t.co/QsEbBxfJED

@Yorktone @d_gray_writer @BloomsburySport @DLuxAssociates @YfrontFanzine Stop the Pop Stand clock, cut off the PA system drone,
Prevent the fans from enjoying a last moment of home,
Silence the fans with muffled drum,
Bring out the coffin, let the mourners come.
@d_gray_writer @YfrontFanzine @BloomsburySport @DLuxAssociates @Yorktone When’s the book out?
